resources.string: Unofficial adaptation of the Association of Anaesthetists Quick Reference Handbook (QRH) August 2019 version. www.anaesthetists.org/qrh

Please report any bugs via the issue tracker on the github page, or email matthew.round@nhs.net

The guidelines in this handbook are not intended to be standards of medical care. The ultimate judgement with regard to a particular clinical procedure or treatment plan must be made by the clinician in the light of the clinical data presented and the diagnostic and treatment options available.

This is an unofficial adaptation of the Association of Anaesthetists Quick Reference Handbook. It is not endorsed by the Association of Anaesthetists.

The guidelines in this handbook are not intended to be standards of medical care. The ultimate judgement with regard to a particular clinical procedure or treatment plan must be made by the clinician in the light of the clinical data presented and the diagnostic and treatment options available.

The developer assumes no responsibility or liability for any errors or omissions in the content. The information is provided on an "as is" basis with no guarantees of completeness, accuracy, usefulness or timeliness. The developer, handbook authors, or anyone else connected in any way with the works, cannot be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked from this application."
